title: Student and Staff Computing Devices
installation: Deliveries and deployments must include white glove services, such as asset decaling, asset reporting, etching on laptops, and delivery to varied locations. For Windows devices, Autopilot is required; for Chromebooks, enrollment in Google Management is required. Both etching and asset tagging are required. No securing of desktops is required.
additional_documentation_required: Table for discount percentage per tier
bid_summary: This addendum provides responses to vendor questions for RFP JA-207652, concerning student and staff computing devices. It clarifies requirements for delivery timelines, warranty specifications (OEM, duration, ADP), white-glove services, technical specifications (USB ports, webcam, chargers), required documentation, and submission guidelines.
product_specification: Minimum USB 3.1 port required for non-touch display monitors. Etching is only required on laptops, but both etching and asset tagging are required for all devices. Warranties must be from the OEM: 1-year for student Chromebooks and 3-years for student and staff Windows laptops. Accidental Damage Protection is not required. AIO Desktops must include a webcam. Windows devices require Autopilot setup, and Chromebooks require Google Management enrollment. Laptop battery life is based on manufacturer specs. Minimum 65w chargers for Chromebooks.
